name: Artemisia vulgaris

Eyes: Pain and burning of vision; better, rubbing; worse, using eyes
Head: Mouth drawn to left
Drawn back by spasmodic twitchings
Congestion of brain

details: Has some reputation as a remedy for epileptic conditions, and convulsive diseases of childhood and girls at puberty. Locally and internally is injurious to eyes. PETIT MAL. Epilepsy without aura; after fright and other violent emotions and after masturbation. Several convulsions close together. Somnambulism. Gets up at night and works, remembers nothing in the morning. (Kali-phos.)
dosage: First to third potency. Said to act better when given with wine.
